Sentencas: Cubic perovskites BaxSr1-xCo0.8Fe0.2O3-delta (BSCF) are among the most promising oxygen permeable membrane materials and high-performance cathode materials for intermediate temperature solid oxide fuel cells.
Titulo: Structural instability of cubic perovskite BaxSrxSr1-xCo1-yFeyO3-δ

Sentencas: Here, we show that cubic BSCF becomes unstable in air at intermediate temperatures and gradually transforms to a hexagonal perovskite on cooling.
Titulo: Structural instability of cubic perovskite BaxSrxSr1-xCo1-yFeyO3-δ

Sentencas: Cubic and hexagonal BSCF polymorphs were observed to coexist below 850-900 degrees C, and the amount of the hexagonal polymorph was shown to increase at the expense of the cubic polymorph with decreasing temperature.
Titulo: Structural instability of cubic perovskite BaxSrxSr1-xCo1-yFeyO3-δ

Sentencas: Different chemical composition of the two coexisting phases was inferred, but a complete transformation to the hexagonal polymorph was hindered by slow cation diffusion.
Titulo: Structural instability of cubic perovskite BaxSrxSr1-xCo1-yFeyO3-δ

Sentencas: Due to the sluggish kinetics, usual cooling rates lead to the meta-stable cubic BSCF, but over time the transition to the stable hexagonal polymorph may be detrimental to applications incorporating BSCF.
Titulo: Structural instability of cubic perovskite BaxSrxSr1-xCo1-yFeyO3-δ

Sentencas: We show that the transformation of the cubic to hexagonal polymorph of BSCF can be rationalized by the Goldschmidt tolerance factor and accordingly suppressed by appropriate substitutions.
Titulo: Structural instability of cubic perovskite BaxSrxSr1-xCo1-yFeyO3-δ
Structural instability of cubic perovskite BaxSrxSr1-xCo1-yFeyO3-δ
